title: Scripty font identification
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905063549im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bargain%20days_4075.jpg)
  
I would very much appreciate if anyone knows which font this is, i know it’s a little tweaked as you can see the “a” is different all three times, but if anyone would know from where it’s originated I would really appreciate it.

Thanx  
Sruly

 [‹ Identify Bitmap kind of font similar to "Chubu 08" and "Megaton"](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905063549/http:/typophile.com/node/47350 "Go to previous forum topic") [The Black dog Typeface - Caslon Antique ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905063549/http:/typophile.com/node/47327 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Sruly P

comments.content: Indeed, and Michael would know it. You might dig [Sarah Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905063549/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/borges_lettering/sarah_script_regular/) if you insist on using a font.
[Mr Dafoe](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905063549/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/55) might be a useful alternative too.
Looks to me very close to the works of **[Charles Borges de Oliveira](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905063549/http:/www.borgeslettering.com/)**...

Very similar, but also Glenn Yoshiyama or Iskra Johnson if it emanates from the Northwest. Georgia Deaver, Sherry Bringham or John Burns from California. John Stevens from North Carolina. Possibly Ivan Angelic from Canada.

Each of these people are capable of rendering something like this and have done something similar in the past. There are others but these people would be a good place to start

I can rule myself out ’cause I did not do it.

Michael

My candidate for this lettering would be [Rob Leuschke](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905063549/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=Leuschke), who has done several fonts that are quite similar (especially QuitcherBychen & TheNautiGal). I mention him often, because it seems so many casual scripts show up here as questions.

However, i agree that the sample looks hand-drawn, and not a font.

- Mike Yanega

Talked to Rob, twern’t his as I thought. I left out Eliza Schulte in Florida. There are nuances that are proprietary to artists and I think the group I suggested is a good start. But I have been stupid and wrong before.

Michael

I just came across the ’Bargain Days’ lettering, if anyone is still curious who the lettering artist is - it’s Ivan Angelic. Seems like Michael recognized my work.

Ivan Angelic
Your work is impressive, Ivan. Thank you for introducing yourself! Now I have another fine letterer to add to my list of recommendations.

Thanks Stephen, participating in this site is a little new to me, I’m looking forward to being a part of it.

Ivan
